1.text: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us; Behold, and see our reproach.

2.text: Our inheritance is turned unto strangers, Our houses unto aliens.

3.text: We are become orphans and fatherless, Our mothers are as widows.

4.text: We have drunk our water for money; Our wood cometh to us for price.

5.text: To our very necks we are pursued; We labour, and have no rest.

6.text: We have given the hand to Egypt, And to Assyria, to have bread enough;

7.text: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; And we have borne their iniquities.

8.text: Servants rule over us; There is none to deliver us out of their hand.

9.text: We get our bread with the peril of our lives Because of the sword of the wilderness.

10.text: Our skin is hot like an oven Because of the burning heat of famine.

11.text: They have ravished the women in Zion, The maidens in the cities of Judah.

12.text: Princes are hanged up by their hand; The faces of elders are not honoured.

13.text: The young men have borne the mill, And the children have stumbled under the wood.

14.text: The elders have ceased from the gate, The young men from their music.

15.text: The joy of our heart is ceased; Our dance is turned into mourning.

16.text: The crown is fallen from our head; Woe unto us! for we have sinned.

17.text: For this our heart is faint, For these things our eyes are dim;

18.text: For the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, The foxes walk upon it.

19.text: Thou, O LORD, art enthroned for ever, Thy throne is from generation to generation.

20.text: Wherefore dost Thou forget us for ever, And forsake us so long time?

21.text: Turn Thou us unto Thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; Renew our days as of old.

22.text: Thou canst not have utterly rejected us, And be exceeding wroth against us!
